trans-unit.source: Provides helper methods and fields for initiating drag-and-drop operations, including a method to begin a drag-and-drop operation, and facilities for adding and removing drag-and-drop related event handlers.

Drag-and-drop commonly refers to a method of data transfer that involves using a mouse (or some other pointing device) to select one or more objects, dragging these objects over some desired drop target in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)], and dropping them.
A drag-and-drop operation is analogous to a copy (or cut)-and-paste operation that is used to transfer data from one object or application to another.
Drag-and-drop operations typically involve two parties: a drag source from which the dragged data originates and a drop target which receives the dropped data.
The events and methods required for drag-and-drop operations are defined in the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop> class.
The drag-and-drop events are attached events that can be attached to any <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> or <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement>.
The drag source and drop target may be UI elements in the same application or in different applications.
However, the drop target must know how to process the data being passed by the drag source.

The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> and <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> classes contain aliases for the drag-and-drop events so that the events appear in the class members list when these classes are inherited as a base class.

When you attach an event handler to a drag-and-drop event on one of these classes, the handler is attached to the underlying <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop> event and they receive the same instance of event data.
For example, see <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Drop?displayProperty=fullName>.
The drag source initiates a drag-and-drop operation by calling the static <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DoDragDrop%2A> method and passing the transferred data to it.
An element typically handles the following events when it is a drag source:
An element typically handles the following events when it is a drop target:
For more information and examples, see [Drag and Drop Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/drag-and-drop-overview.md).
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.DragEnter"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragEnter> event occurs when an object is dragged into the element's bounds.
This method adds a handler for the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragEnter> event.
To add a handler for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddPreviewDragEnterHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.DragLeave"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragLeave> event occurs when an object is dragged out of the element's bounds.
This method adds a handler for the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragLeave> event.
To add a handler for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddPreviewDragLeaveHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.DragOver"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragOver> event occurs when an object is dragged over the element's bounds.
This method adds a handler for the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragOver> event.
To add a handler for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddPreviewDragOverHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.Drop"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.Drop> event occurs when an object is dropped within an element's bounds.
This method adds a handler for the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.Drop> event.
To add a handler for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddPreviewDropHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.GiveFeedback"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.GiveFeedback> event occurs during a drag operation.
This method adds a handler for the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.GiveFeedback> event.
To add a handler for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddPreviewGiveFeedbackHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragEnter"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragEnter> event occurs when an object is dragged into the element's bounds.
This method adds a handler for the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragEnter> event.
To add a handler for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddDragEnterHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragLeave"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragLeave> event occurs when an object is dragged out of the element's bounds.
This method adds a handler for the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragLeave> event.
To add a handler for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddDragLeaveHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragOver"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragOver> event occurs when n object is dragged over the element's bounds.
This method adds a handler for the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragOver> event.
To add a handler for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddDragOverHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDrop"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDrop> event occurs when an object is dropped within an element's bounds.
This method adds a handler for the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDrop> event.
To add a handler for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddDropHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewGiveFeedback"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewGiveFeedback> event occurs during a drag operation.
This method adds a handler for the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewGiveFeedback> event.
To add a handler for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddGiveFeedbackHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewQueryContinueDrag"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.

The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewQueryContinueDrag> event occurs during a drag-and-drop operation, and enables the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.
This method adds a handler for the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewQueryContinueDrag> event.
To add a handler for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddQueryContinueDragHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.QueryContinueDrag"></xref> event handler to a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.QueryContinueDrag> event occurs during a drag-and-drop operation, and enables the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.
This method adds a handler for the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.QueryContinueDrag> event.
To add a handler for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.AddPreviewQueryContinueDragHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
Initiates a drag-and-drop operation.
It is the responsibility of your application to determine when a drag occurs, and then initiate the drag-and-drop operation.
Typically, this is when a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseDown> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseMove> sequence of events occurs over the element to be dragged.
You initiate the drag-and-drop operation by calling the static <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DoDragDrop%2A> method and passing the transferred data to it.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DoDragDrop%2A> method will automatically wrap the data in a <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> if necessary.
For greater control over the data format, you can wrap the data in a <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> before passing it to the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DoDragDrop%2A> method.

The value returned from the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DoDragDrop%2A> method is the value of the <xref:System.Windows.DragEventArgs.Effects%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property set in the drop target’s <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.Drop> event handler.
If the return value does not match one of the `allowedEffects` specified in the call to <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DoDragDrop%2A>, the drag-and-drop operation is not performed.
A reference to the dependency object that is the source of the data being dragged.
A data object that contains the data being dragged.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDropEffects"></xref> values that specifies permitted effects of the drag-and-drop operation.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDropEffects"></xref> values that specifies the final effect that was performed during the drag-and-drop operation.
dragSource or data is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.DragEnter"></xref> attached event.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragEnter> event occurs when an object is dragged into the element's bounds.
This field identifies the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragEnter> event.
For an identifier for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragEnterEvent>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.DragLeave"></xref> attached event
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragLeave> event occurs when an object is dragged out of the element's bounds.
This field identifies the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragLeave> event.
For an identifier for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragLeaveEvent>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.DragOver"></xref> attached event
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragOver> event occurs when an object is dragged over the element's bounds.
This field identifies the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragOver> event.
For an identifier for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragOverEvent>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.Drop"></xref> attached event
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.Drop> event occurs when an object is dropped within an element's bounds.
This field identifies the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.Drop> event.
For an identifier for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDropEvent>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.GiveFeedback"></xref> attached event
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.GiveFeedback> event occurs during a drag operation.

For an identifier for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewGiveFeedbackEvent>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragEnter"></xref> attached event

This field identifies the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragEnter> event.

Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragOver"></xref> attached event
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragOver> event occurs when n object is dragged over the element's bounds.
This field identifies the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDragOver> event.
For an identifier for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragOverEvent>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDrop"></xref> attached event
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDrop> event occurs when an object is dropped within an element's bounds.
This field identifies the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewDrop> event.
For an identifier for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DropEvent>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewGiveFeedback"></xref> attached event
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewGiveFeedback> event occurs during a drag operation.
This field identifies the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewGiveFeedback> event.
For an identifier for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.GiveFeedbackEvent>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewQueryContinueDrag"></xref> attached event

The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewQueryContinueDrag> event occurs during a drag-and-drop operation, and enables the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.
This field identifies the tunneling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewQueryContinueDrag> event.
For an identifier for the bubbling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.QueryContinueDragEvent>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.QueryContinueDrag"></xref> attached event
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.QueryContinueDrag> event occurs during a drag-and-drop operation, and enables the drag source to determine whether the drag-and-drop operation should be canceled.
This field identifies the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.QueryContinueDrag> event.
For an identifier for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.PreviewQueryContinueDragEvent>.
Removes a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.DragEnter"></xref> event handler from a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragEnter> event occurs when an object is dragged into the element's bounds.
This method removes a handler for the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragEnter> event.
To remove a handler for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.RemovePreviewDragEnterHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) from which to remove the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be removed.
Removes a <xref href="System.Windows.DragDrop.DragLeave"></xref> event handler from a specified dependency object.
The <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragLeave> event occurs when an object is dragged out of the element's bounds.
This method removes a handler for the bubbling version of the <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.DragLeave> event.
To remove a handler for the tunneling version of this event, see <xref:System.Windows.DragDrop.RemovePreviewDragLeaveHandler%2A>.
The dependency object (a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>) from which to remove the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be removed.
